SEARCH

Class astar_base

java.lang.Object
astar_base
public class astar_base extends Object
Superclass of myastar, which is to be student-defined. This class contains a 2D array Map. and a costof vector defining the cost of each type of terrain. The main purpose of this class is to generate a random Map with different types of terrain (in its constructor). It offers some convenient functions that will make writing the subclass easier.

    • DY

      public static int[] DY
      The y-coordinate displacement vector for each of the six possible neighbors of a hexagon stored in a 2D array.

    • DX

      public static int[][] DX
      The x-coordinate displacement vector for each of the six possible neighbors of a hexagon stored in a 2D array. The x-displacement is dependent on whether the y coordinate is even or odd, and is thus a 2D array. For example, to calculate the Northwest neighbor of coordinates y,x, the y coordinate of the neighbor is y+DY[NW] and the x coordinate of the neighbor is x+DX[y%2][NW].

    • RandFactor

      protected static double RandFactor

    • costof

      protected int[] costof

    • Map

      protected int[][] Map
      The 2D array that's rendered by hexagons, representing a map and a graph where each node has up to six neighbors. The values in the matrix indicates the terrain type: land (open), desert, fire or water. This protected value is directly accessible in the myastar subclass to be written by students.

    • ROWS

      protected int ROWS
      The number of rows in Map

    • COLS

      protected int COLS
      The number of columns in Map

  • Method Details

    • setRandFactor

      public static void setRandFactor(double x)
      This function sets RandFactor and controls the random map generation, It must be set to a value between 0 and 0.166, exclusively.

    • setcosts

      public void setcosts(int l, int d, int f, int w)
      Sets the costof vector that defines the cost of each type of terrain, in order of land (open), desert, fire (volcano) and water. Deserts are not currently generated and is reserved for future expansion. A negative value indicates that the terrain type is impassible, implying that there may be no path to the desired destination.

    • customize

      public void customize()
      This function currently does nothing, but is called by the constructor before it does anything else. It can be overriden to customize a variety of properties.

    • hash_key

      public int hash_key(int y, int x)
      This convenient function transforms a y,x coordinate into a one-dimensional coordinate. It can be called from a subclass that uses a hashmap or hashset that hashes integers.

    • hexdist

      public static int hexdist(int y1, int x1, int y2, int x2)
      Determines the distance between hex coordinates y1,x1 and y2,x2. Note: this function does not give exact distance but does not overestimate it, so it is admissible for algorithm A*

    • make_neighbor

      public coord make_neighbor(coord parent, int y, int x, int ty, int tx)
      Students can optionally call this function from their myastar subclass. It will create a coord object for coordinates y,x adjacent to coord parent (which will become its parent). It sets known distance of the coord object to be the known distance of the parent plus costof[M[y][x]]), and adds the heuristic estimate by calling the hexdist(int,int,int,int) function. It does not, however, check if any coordinates are out of bounds or passable.

    • search

      public Optional<coord> search(int sy, int sx, int ty, int tx)
      This function currently returns Optional.empty(), indicating that no path is found. Students must override this function in their myastar subclass to implement Algorithm A*. It must return a coord object with coordinates ty,tx (target) and with its parent pointer set to eventually lead back to coordinates with sy,sx (source).
